The objective of this challenge will be for a competition for 4 category's, which are the following:

- Range

- Weight

- Size

- Transport capacity(optional)

You can enter into just one of them, or all 4.

The points are gained in the following fashion,

Range:

+1 for each Kilometre you flew before running out of fuel

+1 for each Kilometre(1000 metres) of altitude you can achieve before engines begin flaming out.

+10 for each circumnavigation of the planet(Kerbin), Polar or along the equator.

Weight:

+1 for each 0.1 of mass

+10 for a mass of over 20 tons

+15 for a mass over 50 tons

+20 for a mass over 100 tons

+10 if your cargo weights over 10 tons

Size:

+1 for each 0.1 in height

+1 for each 0.5 in width or length

+5 if its over 9 metres tall, and 25 metres long and wide

+50 if your plane is taller than it is wide(weird plane award)

Transport Capacity:

+1 for each 0.1 mass of the cargo

+5 if you can detach the cargo in the air without it self destructing

+5 If the cargo lands unharmed

There will also be a few bonus ways to acquire points

Old Fashioned - Use propeller engines(+10)

Gotta go fast! - Go over the speed of sound(+15)

Kerbal style - Land your plane backwards(+50)

Long range - Your plane can refuel in flight (+25)

Where'd the air go? - You went sub orbital(No rapiers or rockets though)(+20)

Efficient - Use just 2 engines(+10)

Partying - Have a capacity of Kerbels over 50(+25)

Low budget - Land on the Island Airstrip at some point(+10)

Penalities -

How to land for dummies - When landing, end up crashing the plane(-50)

Whats going on here? - Your plane loses some parts in the air that are not intentionally lost (like drop tanks)(-25)

The camera is dirty - Your plane is a drone(no kerbals) on board (-25)

There will also be a set of rules, they are the following:

No infiniglide

Pictures or a video will be required for proof.

Pictures can be taken in hanger, or in flight to prove the weight of a plane and its size, however, there must be a picture of it flying.

If you crash the plane and awaken the Kraken, it is only your own fault.

No use of the debug console(Infinite fuel, unbreakable joints, etc)

The use of drop tanks is permitted, but they do not count as cargo capacity, and so cannot be counted open in that way.

The mods that will not be allowed is anything that will generally add unbalanced parts, as well as no mods like Hyper edit.

There will be a stock and modded score board, and there will be five separate scoreboards, with 4 for the specialized category's and one for the best overall plane.

I'd suggest a different scoring:

Range:

+1 for each Kilometre you flew before running out of fuel (okay)

+100 for each Kilometre(1000 metres) of altitude you can achieve before engines begin flaming out. (since it needs to be in balance with the distance)

+1000 for each circumnavigation of the planet(Kerbin), Polar or along the equator. (since kerbin has a radius of 600, a circumnavigation brings 3769 points, 10 extra points for a circumnavigation are pretty useless)

Weight:

+1 for each 0.1 of mass (okay)

+20 for a mass of over 20 tons (at 20 tons, you already gained 200 points, 10 extra is a bit low)

+30 for a mass over 50 tons (same here)

+40 for a mass for every 100 tons of mass (for taking into account that people build big planes)

+50 for every FULL ore container as cargo. (everyone has an ore container in 1.0.2)

Size:

+1 for each 0.1 in height

+1 for each 0.5 in width or length

+5 if its over 9 metres tall, and 25 metres long and wide

+50 if your plane is taller than it is wide(weird plane award)

Transport Capacity:

+1 for each 0.1 mass of the cargo

+5 if you can detach the cargo in the air without it self destructing

+5 If the cargo lands unharmed

There will also be a few bonus ways to acquire points (which I would account as multiplicators, since those achievements also depend on the size of the craft)

Old Fashioned - Use propeller engines(x1.1) (nice, but if you mean the firespitter propeller, keep in mind, that they run on electricity and therefor probably can stay infinitely in air)

Gotta go fast! - Go over the speed of sound(x1.15) 

Kerbal style - Land your plane backwards(x2)

Long range - Your plane can refuel in flight (x2) (landing backwards is hard)

Where'd the air go? - You went sub orbital(No rapiers or rockets though)(x1.3)

Efficient - Use just 2 engines(x1.1)

Partying - Have a capacity of Kerbels over 50(x3)

Low budget - Land on the Island Airstrip at some point(x1.2)

extra achievements: 

Something can go wrong - Have kerbal rescue capability built in (droppods or so) (x(1.2 +0.02 per additional kerbal) 4 kerbals would bei x1.28)

Helicopter-like - Build a vertical takeof capable plane (x1.2)

Refuel anywhere - Have a refinery and drills on board, cargo-orecontainers need to be locked - (x2)

and as rules:

no rocket motors, no orbits, rapiers only in air-breathing mode, no ion engines. otherwise people build a spaceplane and go on a high orbit around kerbin --> infinite points.
